english-words.definition: to hate very, very much; to detest utterly

english-words.example: He abominates the twelve hour drive.

english-words.definition: difficult to understand
english-words.example: many abstruse theories; directions to the party were very abstruse

english-words.definition: a bottomless pit; a yawning gulf; a profound depth or void
english-words.example: The lost spaceship wandered aimlessly in the vast abyss of the galaxy.; They were disheartened and faced an emotional abyss of despair.; staring down the abyss of the mine shaft

english-words.definition: to highlight; to emphasize or stress; to accent
english-words.example: deepened and accentuated by

english-words.definition: an award; an honor; approval; praise
english-words.example: receieved accolades for …

english-words.definition: to scold gently; to warn; an act or action of admonishing; to counsel or advise against something
english-words.example: I was admonished

english-words.definition: a sworn written statement made before an official
english-words.example: had an affidavit from her neighbor giving her permission to cut down the tree; The chairman accepted an affidavit from the claimant, who was too ill to appear before the county commission.

english-words.definition: to exaggerate, put on a false front, and make something look greater and grander than it really is; to increase in size; to enlarge
english-words.example: To aggrandize his achievements, he would make up unbelievable stories of personal accomplishments.; the greatest aggrandizement of the entire evening; He aggrandized his assets by borrowing so much money and buying extravagant homes, cars, and boats.

english-words.definition: to mistreat; to do greivous injury to; to distress
english-words.example: She is always aggrieved.

english-words.definition: cheerful eagerness or readiness to respond

english-words.definition: to make hostile; to cause to feel unwelcome or estranged
english-words.example: The boss alienated his secretary by shouting at her.; He felt alienated from the rest of the team.

english-words.definition: to ease a pain or burdern; to relieve, usually temporarily or incompletely; to lessen
english-words.example: alleviated the need for…; alleviates painful headaches

english-words.definition: to entice with something desirable; to tempt; fascination; charm; appeal; very attractive or tempting; enticing; seductive; something that attracts or entices
english-words.example: Not all fish lures allure all fish.; allured the crowd; were allured into believing that…; allured by the thought of wealth

english-words.definition: atmosphere; mood; feeling
english-words.example: an ambience of gaiety; The ambience in the Italian restaurant was delightful; there was soft music, candlelight, and…

english-words.definition: agreeable; obedient; willing to give in to the wishes of another; responsible to authority
english-words.example: always amenable to any reasonable solution to a problem; Sarah was amenable to calling back tomorrow when the office would be open.

english-words.definition: without definite shape, substance, or form; lacking definition and boundaries
english-words.example: an amorphous count

english-words.definition: lack of emotion or interest; indifference
english-words.example: He showed apathy toward the matter.

english-words.definition: highest point
english-words.example: the apex of his career

english-words.definition: known or understood by very few; mysterious; secret; obscure; esoteric
english-words.example: an arcane topic

english-words.definition: characteristic of an earlier time; antiquated; old; ancient; outdated
english-words.example: archaic idea of dating; archaic farm tools

english-words.definition: difficult; laborious; requiring great exertion; tiresome
english-words.example: arduous chore/hike/exercise

english-words.definition: feature; attribute
english-words.example: That's its greatest aspect.

english-words.definition: to seek, attain, or achieve a goal
english-words.example: He didn’t aspire to anything. He had no goals or career direction.; career aspiration

english-words.definition: to soothe; to make less severe; to ease; to lessen; to pacify; to ease the pain of; to relieve
english-words.example: tried to assuage her disappointment

english-words.definition: quick in discernment; shrewd; clever; keen in judgment; perceptive; intelligent

english-words.definition: to besiege; beset; surround; harass; subjected to oppressive or grievous forces; harrassed

english-words.definition: to surround; to harass
english-words.example: beset with rain and cold weather.; beset with design problems; beset with disappointment.

english-words.definition: extremely unconventional or far-fetched

english-words.definition: to talk nonsensically; to talk long-windedly without making much sense (without real substance)

english-words.definition: to support; to strengthen; to augment; to build up

english-words.definition: briefness; the quality or state of being brief in duration

english-words.definition: customary cultural standards; moral attitudes, manners, habits

english-words.definition: shaped with folds or waves; shaped into folds and alternating ridges and grooves

english-words.definition: willingness to believe or trust too readily, especially without proper or adequate evidence

english-words.definition: to spread out or disperse; not concentrated; characterized by great length or discursiveness in speech or writing; wordy; widely spread or scattered; dispersed
english-words.example: When the bottle broke, the fragrance diffused throughout the room

I didn't mean for it to sound disparaging. I don't want to say anything disparaging.;
Don't disparage them for their ignorance.; disparaging remarks

english-words.definition: without passion; objective; neutral

english-words.definition: to drive away; to dismiss; to dissipate; to cause to vanish

english-words.example: Beneath his erudite image, Dr. John Brinkley was a money-grubbing con man.; Most professional speakers are erudite.; to have erudition; an indication of his erudition

english-words.definition: hard to understand; understood by only a select few; peculiar
english-words.example: esoteric knowledge; esoteric experience

english-words.definition: pleasant sound (opposite of cacophony); pleasing to the ear
english-words.example: a sweet euphonious voice; the low, euphonious croaking of the summer frogs; grunting of a mature elephant seal

english-words.definition: to elude or avoid by cunning; to flee from a pursuer
english-words.example: evaded the authorities; evade helping her sister wash the dishes

english-words.definition: to summon forth; to draw forth; to awaken; to produce or suggest

english-words.definition: exceeding normal bounds; greater or more than seems reasonable
english-words.example: exorbitant price

english-words.definition: a superficial appearance or illusion of something; the front of a building; the false front or misleading appearance of anything

english-words.definition: to make easier; to help bring about
english-words.example: a mediator, not a facilitator; facilitate learning; facilitate the sale

english-words.definition: to show affection
english-words.example: didn't see through the fawning of all his underlings; sucking up of the professional fawner; fawned over her grandchildren

english-words.definition: to give a false appearance of: feign sleep; to represent falsely; pretend; to imitate so as to deceive: to fabricate; to fake

english-words.definition: to generate pus; to become a source of irritation or resentment

english-words.definition: any thing or activity to which one is irrationally devoted; an object of unreasonable attention
english-words.example: fetish for tea/chocolate; a shoe/cat fetish

english-words.definition: often changing or likely to change for no good reason; unpredictable; not loyal or consistent

english-words.example: It was done for efficacy, not for finesse.

english-words.definition: to defraud, swindle; also the wool of a sheep or similar animal

spanish-words.definition: to remove, to come off, to separate

spanish-words.definition: stage (of a process); phase (of a process)
